item.shincolle.combatration3: Combat Ration (Rice Ball XL, Grudge Flavour)
item.shincolle.equipmachinegun6: 4-Inch Twin Dual Purpose Gun Mount + CIC
item.shincolle.equipairplane20: Abyssal Liberation Land-based Dive Bomber Ace
gui.shincolle.book.chap0.title: Introduction
gui.shincolle.book.chap0.text0d0:
§cShinkeiseikan§0 are a group of lovely ship girls born from iron and grudge, who natively dwell in the ocean.

But one day, a fleet of beings called §9Kanmusu§0 appeared with horrible weapons and began to attack §cShinkeiseikan§0 in their habitat without apparent reason.
gui.shincolle.book.chap0.text0d1:
Because of these attacks, §cShinkeiseikan§0 everywhere are facing a serious crisis of survival.

Only one person can lead these ladies out of despair, YOU... become an §4Abyssal Admiral§0 and save them from this crisis!
gui.shincolle.book.chap0.text1d0:
Explore the world and collect the four resources: §dGrudge§0, §dAbyssium§0, §dGrudgeful Ammo§0 and §dPolymetal§0 to construct §cShinkeiseikan§0.

§cShinkeiseikan§0 will protect the owner and attack any hostile mobs if they have a sufficient supply of resources.
gui.shincolle.book.chap0.text1d1: Now go out and collect these lovely ladies!
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.title: Resources
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text0d0: §d§nGrudge§r§0 is the residue left behind after a mob dies. It is also the fuel used by §cShinkeiseikan§0.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text0d1:
You can kill mobs to get §d§nGrudge§r§0, or you can build a mob farm to secure a steady supply of §d§nGrudge§r§0.


Combine 9 §d§nGrudge§r§0 to get 1 §9Grudge Lump§0, and combine §9Grudge Lumps§0 to get 1 §9Heavy Grudge Lump§0.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text1d0: §d§nAbyssium§r§0 is a metal enchanted by grudge and is the main material used to build §cShinkeiseikan§0 and their equipment.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text1d1: Combine 1 Grudge and 1 Iron Ingot to get 1 §d§nAbyssium§r§0, 9 ingots can be combined to get 1 §9Abyssium Block§0.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text2d0: §d§nPolymetal§r§0 mainly spawned in the water type biomes (ocean, river, beach). It's the main material to build §cShinkeiseikan§0 and equipments.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text2d1:
This crunchy metal ball is one a favored snack of aircraft carriers.

You can find lots of §d§nPolymetallic Gravel§r§0 on the seabed.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text3d1:
In addition to iron, you can also use copper, gold, and diamond to make different quantities of ammo.

Replacing the §9Gunpowder§0 with §9Blazepowder§0 will produce heavy ammo instead.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text4d0: §d§nRepair Buckets§r§0 are made from the most nutritious lava of the ocean, seasoned with grudge, and are the most popular drinks for §cShinkeiseikan§0.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text4d1:
Right click on ship with a §d§nRepair Bucket§r§0 to repair her.

Ships can automatically use §d§nRepair Buckets§r§0 in their inventory.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text5d0:
§d§nShinkeiseikan Wedding Ring§r

With the classic minimalist style of prong mount and Nether Star Cut, the §d§nShinkeiseikan Wedding Ring§r generously showcases the light of Nether Star.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text5d1:
A §d§nShinkeiseikan Wedding Ring§r symbolizes the beauty of Nether and the strength of the owner, and is also an important sign of lasting love.

§9Sneak+Right Click§0:
Marry the ship.
§9Right Click§0:
Activate the ring.

The ring will grant different abilities depending on the number of married ships: digging speed, vision, breathing, mobility in liquid, and immunity to fire.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text6d0: The §d§nShinkeiseikan Ownership Paper§r§0 describes the contents of the various items in detail, as well as the transfer of ownership which two parties should fulfill, to take effect after signature of the involved parties.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text6d1:
§9Right Click§0:
Sign the paper.

After both parties sign, the owner can sneak + right click the paper on a ship to transfer ownership to another player.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text7d0: §d§nDismantle Hammer§r§0 can decompose the ship and recycle some of the material.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text7d1:
§9Left Click§0:
One shot kill the ship. (OWNER/OP ONLY)

§9Sneaking + Right Click§0:
Decompose the ship. (OWNER/OP ONLY)
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text8d0: The §d§nModernization Toolkit§r§0 contains a variety of the latest abyssal black-box technology and can be used to upgrade the ship's attributes.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text8d1:
§9Right Click§0 on a ship to upgrade one of her attributes randomly. The level of each attribute is represented by color in ship's inventory GUI:

§fWHITE§0 (Lv1)
§eYELLOW§0 (Lv2)
§6ORANGE§0 (Lv3)
§4RED§0 (Lv4)

The maximum level is §4RED§0 (Lv4).
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text9d0: §d§nInstant Construction Material§r§0 contains some rare materials and a welding gun which provides a temperature higher than ambient, increasing the construction speed of abyssal ships and equipment.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text9d1:
Put the §d§nInstant Construction Material§r§0 in the §9Abyssal Hydrothermal Vent§0 or §9Hadal Hydrothermal Vortex§0 to speed up the construction progress.

§d§nInstant Construction Materials§r§0 can only be crafted from unused ship construction item.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text10d0: Offering the heaviest grudge and diamonds to pray for Abyssal Goddess's protection, §d§nThe Grudge of Abyssal Goddess§r§0 will protect the §cShinkeiseikan§0 from fatal damage and give her a will for vengance that is as deep as the abyss.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text10d1: Put §d§nThe Grudge of Abyssal Goddess§r§0 in ship's inventory. If a ship with  this item in her invenory takes fatal damage, it will be consumed. Upon consumption of the item, the affected ship will recover to full HP and be immune to damage for a while.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text11d0: The §d§nWo-Class Command Scepter§r§0 is the aircraft command equipment for the magical girl Wo-Class. However, the Abyssal Admiral cannot transform into a magical girl. Instead, it can be used by the Abyssal Admiral to command ships.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text11d1:
There are 3 command modes and storage for up to 9 teams, each team having up to 6 ships maximum.

§2Single Mode§0:
Only 1 §3Focus Target§0, command will ONLY apply to the §3Focus Target§0.

§4Group Mode§0:
0~6 §3Focus Targets§0, command will ONLY apply to the §3Focus Targets§0.

§6Formation Mode§0:
Ships move in a specific formation and gain an additional effect, command will apply to ALL ships.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text12d0:
When holding the command scepter, a colored indicator circle will appear, coded as follows:

§2GREEN§0:
The ship is in §2Single Mode§0.
§3CYAN§0:
The ship is the §3Focus Target§0.
§4RED§0:
The ship is in §4Group Mode§0.
§6YELLOW§0:
The ship is in §6Formation Mode§0.
§7WHITE§0:
Guard target.

§9Left Click§0:
Add ship to the team / Add target to attackable list / Set focus target.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text12d1:
§9Sprint+Left Click§0:
Change formation.
§9Sneak+Left Click§0:
Remove team / Change command mode.
§9Sneak+Sprint+Left Click§0:
Clear team.
§9Right Click§0:
Move and guard / Attack / Sit / Caress.
§9Sprint+Right Click§0:
Guard target.
§9Sneak+Right Click§0:
Open ship's inventory / Formation GUI.
§9List Players:§0
Change to caress mode.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text13d0:
§9Formation§0:
Ships will move in formation at the same speed and gain formation buffs. You need 5 or 6 ships in a team to use formation mode.

If a ship is in formation mode, move/guard command in single/group mode will be disabled.

If a ship exists in different teams, the formation buff will apply to only one team.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text13d1:
§2Line Ahead§0:
Artillery combat formation, increases firepower but lowers defence.

§3Double Line§0:
A cruising formation with slight firepower buff.

§4Diamond§0:
Defence formation for aerial combat.

§6Echelon§0:
Charge formation with high movement speed buff.

§7Line Abreast§0:
Defence formation for anti-submarine combat.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text14d0:
§d§nModel 21 Zero Fighter§r§0

Scale: 1/48

Made From: Polymetal

Serving Size: 2500g

Serving Per Container: 1

Shelf Life: §k100§r YR
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text14d1:
This model aircraft complies with Abyssal Edible Toys Standard, it's ZERO CALORIES, FUN and TASTY!

This product contains rich polymetal, which helps with digestion and absorption of heavy metal and effectively promotes children's growth.




**AVOID SUNSHINE, HIGH TEMPERATURE AND HIGH OXYGEN.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text15d0: The §d§nAbyssal Logbook§r§0 contains detailed information about abyssal resources, §cShinkeiseikan§0 and §9Kanmusu§0 found so far.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text16d0: The §d§nAbyssal Portable Radar§r§0 can detect nearby owned ships and remotely contact them or give orders.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text17d0:
This stable and durable §d§nAbyssal Admiral's Desk§r§0 is made of obsidian. In addition to deal with the official business, it can also block the gunfire from an angry secretary ship.
**Please ask the secretary ship before purchasing any furniture.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text17d1:
§9Radar§0:
Shows a list of nearby owned ships, click ship on the list to carry out other actions.

§9Abyssal Logbook§0:
Items, blocks, and ships introduction.

§9Faction§0:
Create or add team with PVP mode.

§9Target List§0:
Browse attack tFramearget list.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text18d0:
§9Right Click:§0 Change Abyssal Waypoint stay time.

§9Sneak + Right Click:§0 pair Abyssal Waypoint / Abyssal Crane and Chest.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text19d0:
When the lava is compressed by heavy grudge, it will become an §d§nAbyssal Volcano Block§r§0.

Decorative block.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text20d0:
When the lava is compressed by Abyssal Volcano Blocks, it will become an §d§nAbyssal Volcano Core§r§0.

The core will consume grudge and spread the energy into the environment.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text20d1:
To activate the core, place it §9near any liquid block and put some grudge into it§0.

§dEffect Area: width 13 / height 13 (down 6 / up 6) blocks§0.

If a ship is in a liquid block within the effect area, she will regenerate HP and morale.

The energy is said to maintain skin and beauty, it's very popular among the Shinkeiseikan.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text21d0:
Twisted abyssal frame, decorative block.

It's also climbable like a ladder.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text22d0:
Waypoint block, player can link waypoints with a §dTarget Wrench§0.

If a ship moves to a waypoint, she will continue on to the next waypoint.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text22d1:
§9Right Click§0 with §dTarget Wrench§0 to show the waypoint info.
§9Sneak + Right Click§0 to link two waypoints.

A waypoint can save 1 NEXT and 1 LAST waypoint, and the max distance is 48 blocks.

If a waypoint links back to it's last waypoint (next = last), when the ship moves to the waypoint, the ship will begin to move backwards.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text23d0: A machine block for loading and unloading items to/from a ship. Owner can link the §dAbyssal Crane§0 to §9any chest§0 or other §9Abyssal Waypoint§0 with a §dTarget Wrench§0. A ship will start to load/unload items when she gets to the crane and will go to the next waypoint after the job done.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text23d1:
§9Top Left§0 button is §9Power Switch§0.

§9The Top Largest§0 button is §9Waiting Mode§0.

§9Middle§0 buttons with M/D/N are item matching condition.

§9Center 9x2 Slots§0 are loading/unloading target, left all empty means §9ANY§0 item.

Loading/Unloading can disable separately, and ships will not attack and move while loading/unloading.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text24d0:
§9Right click§0 this book on a ship to increase her level by 5 ~ 10.

This book can be found in dungeon chests as well as crafted.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text25d0:
A fluid container allowing ships to transport liquids. There are 4 sizes of fluid container.
Ships must equip at least one §9Abyssal Pumps Station§0 to transfer fluid to the containers in the ship's inventory at an Abyssal Crane.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text26d0:
§9Right click§0 to set recipe for ship's crafting task.

Please see chap.3 for more details.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text27d0:
§9Numpad 1:§0
§6ADD§r or §cREMOVE§0 entity in §dUnattackable Target List§0. §4(OP ONLY!!)§0

§9Numpad 2:§0
Show §dUnattackable Target List§0.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text27d1:
§dUnattackable Target§0 immune to all ship's attack, and can't be targeted. You can add entities such as leash knot, item frame, cart or boat.

This list applies to hostile mob ships too.

Ships, hostile ships, and ship's summons can't be unattackable targets.
gui.shincolle.book.chap1.text28d0:
The §9Enchant Shell§0 can be made in §cHadal Hydrothermal Vortex§0, and then crafted with 8x the identical potions to apply the potion effect.

Further, crafting with 8x the same potions can increase the effect chance and duration.

Crafting with different potions will replace the potion effect.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.title: Construction
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text0d0: You can start building primary class §cShinkeiseikan§0 in the §9Abyssal Hydrothermal Vent§0 if you have collected enough resources.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text0d1: You need §916~64§0 §4Grudge / Abyssium Ingot / Polymetallic Nodules / Grudgeful Ammo§0 and a large amount of lava as fuel.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text1d0:
After putting resources into the §9Abyssal Hydrothermal Vent§0, click the §4"Ship Spawn Egg"§0 icon on the right side to start building a §cShinkeiseikan§0.

§9Double Click§0 the icon to enter §cContinuously Build Mode§0. In §cContinuously Build Mode§0, the amounts of four resources will be recorded and every construction will consume the recorded resources.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text1d1:
At the end of the construction process, you get a §9Ship Spawn Egg§0, use the egg to create a random §cShinkeiseikan§0.

The user of the spawn egg will become the §cShinkeiseikan§0's owner.

The amounts of different resources will affect the kind of §cShinkeiseikan§0, ex: §dPolymetal§0 will §9increase§0 the prob of §dAircraft Carrier§0.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text2d0:
In general, the more materials consumed, the better Shinkeiseikan you get.

To §9Develop Equipments§0, click the §4"Cannon"§0 icon, the process is the same as with ship building.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text2d1:
§cTips:§0

1. Put §9Instant Construction Material§0 into the fuel slot to speed up build progress.

2. Put an §9EnderTank§4 (mod: EnderStorage)§0 into the fuel slot to refuel lava continuously.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text3d0: When you have accumulated a lot of resources, you can try to build advanced class §cShinkeiseikan§0 in the §9Hadal Hydrothermal Vortex§0.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text3d1:
§9Hadal Hydrothermal Vortex§0 is a 3x3x3 multiblock structure:

§cBottom Layer:§3 3x3 Polymetallic Block§0

§cMiddle Layer: §34 corners of Polymetallic Block§0

§cTop Layer: §3Heavy Grudge Lump§0

§9Right click§0 the §4Heavy Grudge Lump§0 to activate the vortex.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text4d0:
§9To construct advanced §cShinkeiseikan§0:

1. Put resources into the 9 slots.

2. Click 4 resources icon and adjust the value using the arrows.

3. Click §4"Ship Spawn Egg"§0 icon to start construction.

4. §9Double Click§0 to enter §4Continuously Build Mode§0.

NOTE: The leftmost slot cannot be extracted by hopper or pipe, and other slots can only be extracted when the red arrow is in §9Release§0 mode.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text4d1:
Click the §4Red Arrow§0 to change resources mode: §9Release§0 or §9Suck In§0.

Large Ship Construction requires §9100~1000§0 of each resource and lots of lava to process.

And the more materials consumed, the better §cShinkeiseikan§0 you get.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text5d0: The equip development is same with ship construction, put some materials in the §9Abyssal Hydrothermal Vent§0 or §9Hadal Hydrothermal Vortex§0 and click the Equip button to develop equips.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text5d1:
The equip info is decribed in the item tooltip:

Factor Mats:
The number represents the total amount of materials and the effective material.

Rare Level:
Higher the value means the more rare in that equip type.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text6d0:
Equips can be enchanted using enchanted books and an anvil to increase the stats. Enchanting cost is fixed at 30 levels. There are 3 enchant types: §cWeapon§0, §9Armor§0 and §3Misc§0, some enchantment only works on specific type.

§9Protection:§0 +HP.
§9Sharpness, Smite, Bane, Power:§0 +damage, §cWEAPON§0 only.
§9Unbreaking:§0 +DEF, §3ARMOR§0 only.
§9Efficiency:§0 +reload speed.
§9Aqua Affinity, Feather Fall, Depth Strider:§0 +move speed.
gui.shincolle.book.chap2.text6d1:
§9Knockback, Punch:§0 +range.
§9Frost Walker:§0 +critical.
§9Fire, Flame:§0 +double/triple hit.
§9Lure:§0 +miss reduction.
§9Thorns:§0 +AA.
§9Respiration:§0 +ASM.
§9Looting, Fortune, Luck:§0 +exp gain, §cWEAPON§0 only.
§9Silk Touch:§0 +grudge gain, §3NON-WEAPON§0 only.
§9Infinity:§0 +ammo gain, §cWEAPON§0 only.
§9Mending:§0 +HP recovery, §3NON-WEAPON§0 only.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.title: Ship Maintenance Guide
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text0d0:
§91.§0 By construction.

§92.§0 Finding them in dungeon chests.

§93.§0 Defeating spawned hostile ships.


The easiest way is spending resources to build a ship, and you can find some advanced class ships and equipment in dungeon chests.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text0d1:
If you have §dShinkeiseikan Wedding Ring§0 in inventory and in the §9Sea/Beach§0 biome, the hostile fleet may appear on the sea.

You can get a ship's spawn egg by defeating the spawned hostile ship.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text1d0:
§91.§0 Ship consume §cGrudge§0 as fuel. Ship cannot do anything without enough §cGrudge§0.

§92.§0 Ships consume §98 §cGrudge§0 per day in idle mode.

§93.§0 Moving consumes extra §cGrudge§0.

§94.§0 Attacking consumes §cGrudge§0 and §dAmmo§0.

§95.§0 Aircraft attacks consume §cGrudge§0, §dAmmo§0 and an §3Airplane§0.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text1d1:
§96.§0 The amount of airplanes replenishes over time.

§97.§0 Put consumable items into a ship's inventory, she will automatically use them.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text2d0:
§91. Right Click§0: sit/stand.

§92. Sneaking + Right Click§0: Open ship's GUI.

§93.§0 You can set party/formation with §cWo-Class Command Scepter§0.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text2d1:
§91.§0 Ships gain exp on attacking, regardless of if they actually hit the target.

§92.§0 Shisp level up when their exp reaches the limit.

§93.§0 Max level is §9100§0 / §c150§0 for §dMarried§0 ship.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text3d0:
§91.§0 6 Attributes: §cHP§0/§cFirepower§0/§cArmor§0/§cAttack Speed§0/§cMoving Speed§0/§cAttack Range§0.

§92.§0 Attribute value is calculated from §3Ship Level§0 and §dAttribute Level§0.

§93.§0 4 Attribute Level: §fWhite§9(1)§0/§eYellow§9(2)§0/§6Orange§9(3)§0/§4Red§9(4)§0.

§94.§0 Upgrade attribute level by using a §cModernization Toolkit§0.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text3d1:
§91.§0 Equipment provide some attribute values.

§92.§0 Develop equips in §cAbyssal Hydrothermal Vent / Vortex§0.

§93.§0 Up to §96§0 equips for a ship.

§94.§0 3 type of equips: §9General§0 / §3Carrier Only§0 / §4Non-Carrier Only§0.

§95.§0 Aviation Battleships can use all type of equipment.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text4d0:
§91. Critical§0: Deals §c150%%§0 damage. (§c300%%§0 for §4Torpedo/Missile§0 attack.) Critical attack does not overlap with Double/Triple Hit.

§92. Double Hit§0: Deals §c200%%§0 damage. §4Torpedo/Missile§0 attack does not cause Double Hit. Double Hit does not overlap with Triple Hit.

§93. Triple Hit§0: Deals §c300%%§0 damage. §4Torpedo/Missile§0 attack does not cause Triple Hit.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text4d1:
§94. Miss§0: Deals §c0%%§0 damage and knockback only. §4Torpedo/Missile§0 attack deals §c100%%§0 damage but the trajectory will deviate from target.

§95. Anti-Air§0: Deals additional damage to §4Flying§0 targets.

§96. Anti-SS§0: Deals additional damage to §4Submarine§0 targets.

§97. Dodge§0: Ignore the damage and knockback effect.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text5d0:
§91.§0 Ships will attack mob automatically if they have sufficient §cGrudge§0 and §dAmmo§0.

§92.§0 Ships stop attacking when §4Sitting§0.

§93.§0 Ships can attack while §4Riding§0.

§94.§0 Owner can control attacking with the §4Wo-Class Command Scepter§0.

§95.§0 Owner can adjust the attack AI in the ship's GUI.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text5d1:
§96.§0 Ship will recover HP over time.

§97.§0 Use §4Repair Bucket§0 to recovery HP immediately.

§98.§0 Ship will turn to §4Spawn Egg§0 and drop on the ground if §cHP < 0§0.

§99.§0 Ship's level will §4decrease by 1§0 if §cHP < 0§0.

§910.§0 Owner has to spend exp to respawn the ship from an egg.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text6d0:
§911.§0 Put §4The Grudge of Abyssal Goddess§0 into ship's inventory to avoid death once.

§912.§0 Ship can use §4Repair Bucket§0 automatically in ship's inventory.

§913.§0 There are restraint relations between ships, check: §9https://goo.gl/jmR3Wd§0

§914.§0 In addition to the submarine, all damage will decrease at night.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text7d0:
Owner can adjust some AI settings in the ship's inventory GUI.

§91. Can Melee§0: can melee attack, cost no ammo.

§92. Light Attack§0: Attacks with §cGrudgeful Ammo§0.

§93. Heavy Attack§0: Attacks with §cHeavy Grudgeful Ammo§0.

§94. Light Aircraft§0: Attacks with light aircraft and §cGrudgeful Ammo§0.

§95. Heavy Aircraft§0: Attacks with heavy aircraft and §cHeavy Grudgeful Ammo§0.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text7d1:
§96. Aura Effect§0: Enable special power and wedding ring power.

§97. Follow (Min)§0: Ship stops following within the min distance.

§98. Follow (Max)§0: Ship starts to follow owner at the max distance.

§99. Flee HP%%§0: Forces the ship to follow owner if HP < Flee HP%%.

§910. Passive?§0: Only attacks back when attacked.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text8d0:
§911. Onsight?§0: Only attack target on sight.

§912. PVP Mode§0: Attack §cPVP§0 target first.

§913. Anti-Air§0: Attack §cAircraft§0 first.

§914. Anti-SS§0: Attack §cSubmarine§0 first.
§9Priority§0: §dAnti-Air§0 > §3Anti-SS§0 > §cPVP§0 > Other

§915. PickItem§0: Some ship will pick item when out of combat.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text8d1: §916. Auto Pump§0: Ship can pump liquid by Abyssal Pumps Station (equip) to Abyssal Fluid Drum. If a ship gets some glass bottles, she can collect xp orbs too.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text9d0:
§91.§0 Enable PVP Mode by §cCreating a Fleet§0 in an §3Abyssal Admiral's Desk§0.

§92.§0 Default PVP state is §7Neutral§0 to other fleets.

§93.§0 You can §cAlly/Declare War§0 against other fleets in §3Abyssal Admiral's Desk§0.

§94.§0 Ships will attack other hostile fleets §cPVP Mode§0 in AI options is enabled.

§95.§0 If §cFriendlyFire§0 = §3false§0, AoE attack will not damage to allies.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text9d1:
§96. §cAlly§0 is §3UNILATERAL§0, other side can still be hostile, friendly or neutral.

§97. §cDeclaration of War§0 is §3BILATERAL§0, other side will be hostile too.

§98.§0 Other side will become neutral to you when §cBreaking Alliance§0.

§99.§0 Other side will remain hostile when §cCalling a Truce§0.

§910.§0 You cannot declare war against a fleet in the ally list, and vice versa.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text10d0:
There are restraint relations between ships, check: §9https://goo.gl/jmR3Wd§0

§9Destroyer (DD):§c HIGH speed / LOW HP§0, against SS and Aircraft.
§9Cruiser:§0 Including heavy cruiser (CA), light cruiser (CL) and torpedo cruiser (CLT), average attributes.
§9Aircraft Carrier (CV): §cLONGEST attack range§0, against all ships except SS.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text10d1:
§9Aviation Battleship (BBV):§0 Including BBV and Installation, attributes range between CV and BB. §dInstallation§0 has §cLOW firepower / HIGH HP§0.
§9Battleship (BB):§c LOW speed / HIGH HP and firepower§0, against all but SS and Aircraft.
§9Submarine (SS):§c LOW speed and HP / HIGH firepower§0, against all but Aircraft.
§9Aircraft:§0 Aircraft attack by CV and BBV, against all ships but SS.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text11d0:
Some shinkeiseikan can summon mounts, it can be enabled in §9Appearance§0 page in §9AI Options§0.

§9Right-click§0 on a mount to ride it, then owner can control mount movement and use attack skills.

§9Press move key§0 (default:WASD) and §9jump key§0 (default:SPACE) to control movement.

§9Press hotbar key 1~4§0 (default:1,2,3,4) to use attack skills.
Attack skills consume ship's ammo and grudge, and the cooldown time is counted separately from ship's attack skills.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text12d0:
Status effect can increase or decrease ship's attributes.

§9Speed:§0 +move speed
§cSlowness:§0 -move speed
§9Haste:§0 +attack speed
§cMining Fatigue:§0 -attack speed
§9Strength:§0 +damage
§cWeak:§0 -damage
§9Absorption:§0 +defence and HP
§cPoison:§0 -defence
§9Health Boost:§0 +HP and HP regen
§9Resistance:§0 -damage by torpedo
§9Fire-Resistance:§0 -damage by non-torpedo
§9Jump Boost:§0 +hit range
§cBlind:§0 -hit range greatly
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text12d1:
§cInstant Damage:§0 damage ship
§9Instant Heal:§0 heal ship
§cWither:§0 damage ship over time
§9Regeneration:§0 heal ship over time
§cNausea:§0 +miss rate greatly
§9Night Vision:§0 -80%% damage reduce effect in night
§9Luck:§0 +critical/double/triple hit rate
§cBad Luck:§0 -critical/double/triple hit rate
§9Water Breathing:§0 +ASM and dodge rate
§9Levitation: +AA and dodge rate§0
Hunger: increase resource consumption greatly
§9Saturation:§0 increase resource gained and morale over time
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text13d0:
The morale level will affect ship's attributes and experience gain.

There are 5 level of morale: §dExcited§0, §cHappy§0, §2Normal§0, §9Tired§0, §7Exhausted§0.

The morale level is marked in the upper right corner of ship's inventory GUI.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text13d1:
§9Idle:§0
Recover morale to §2NORMAL§0 state, out of combat faster than in combat.

§9Caress, Kill:§0
Increase morale to §dEXCITED§0 state.

§9Feeding:§0
Increase to §cHAPPY§0 state.

§9Moving, Attack, Damaged:§0
Decrease morale.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text14d0:
Generally the ship don't need to feed, but you can feed ship to increase morale and grudge value manually.

§9Right click§0 on ship with food or some items to feed the ship.

You can only feed a certain times in a period of time.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text14d1:
§9Grudge, Food:§0
Increase grudge, morale value.

§9Ammo:§0
Increase morale and ammo value a little more than automatically consumed by ship.

§9Abyssium, Polymetal:§0
Increase number of aircraft for CV.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text15d0:
The owner can caress ship to reward or simply harass her. A correct caress can §9improve the ship's morale§0 effectively.

To caress ship, hold §dWo-Class Command Scepter§0 and press §9List Players (default: TAB)§0 to change to caress mode, and §9Right Click§0 on the ship.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text15d1:
Caress target is determined by the cross and the relative face angle between owner and ship.

The target are: top, head, face, neck, chest, belly, under belly, leg, arm, back.

Different individuals have different sensitive part, be careful of the reaction when caressing.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text16d0:
Ship can help the owner to cook item:

§91.§0 Click the raw beef icon in AI options
§92.§0 Put the item to be cooked to mainhand slot (the most middle and lower slot in the first page)
§93.§0 Put the fuel item to offhand slot. (option)
§94.§0 Check metadata/forge ore dict/nbt tag in the same AI page. (option)
§95.§0 Move ship to an Abyssal Waypoint.
§96.§0 Link the waypoint and a furnace block by Target Wrench.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text16d1:
§97.§0 Set the input/output/fuel side of the furnace in AI option. (B:Bottom T:Top N:North S:South W:West E:East)
§98.§0 Ship will start cooking the target item except main/offhand slot.

Cooking is a difficult job, less experienced ships sometimes produce some dark matter in cooking.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text17d0:
Ship can go fishing to feed the owner:

§91.§0 Click the fishing rod icon in AI options.
§92.§0 Put the fishing rod to mainhand slot.
§93.§0 Move the ship to the pool with depth >= 3 blocks.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text17d1: §9"Luck of the Sea"§0 enchantment on the fishing rod and luck potion can increase the rate of rare drop from fishing.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text18d0:
Ships can go mining for the lazy owner:

§91.§0 Click the pickaxe icon in AI options.
§92.§0 Put the pickaxe to mainhand slot.
§93.§0 Move the ship to the mine with a lot of solid blocks.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text18d1:
Ships can get ores without breaking blocks.

§9"Fortune"§0 enchantment on the pickaxe and luck potion can increase the number of rare drop from mining.

The mining result is related to world, biome, y level, ship level and pickaxe type.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text19d0:
Ships can craft items for their owner:

§91.§0 Use §cCrafting Recipe§0 to set recipe.
§92.§0 Click the crafting icon in AI options.
§93.§0 Put the recipe to mainhand slot (the most middle and lower slot in the first page).
§94.§0 Clear slots in ship's inventory in 3,4,5 row.
§95.§0 Move ship to an Abyssal Waypoint.
§96.§0 Link the waypoint and a chest block by Target Wrench.
§97.§0 Put some materials in chest to start crafting.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text19d1:
Ship level will affect the number of items can be crafted at a time.

NOTE: Ship will drop crafting items if chest is full.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text20d0:
§cReq: Metamorph mod§0

Features:

§91.§0 Left click with §cTarget Wrench§0 on own ship to get morph.

§92.§0 Kill friendly ship will not drop ghost morph.

§93.§0 Kill mob ship still drop ghost morph.

§94.§0 Press §cSneaking + Morph Action§0 key to open Morph GUI. (Own ship morph only)

§95.§0 You can't open Morph GUI in mob ship morph.
gui.shincolle.book.chap3.text20d1:
§96.§0 Player can use ship attack skill in morph, and can add grudge and ammo in Morph GUI.

§97.§0 Player can level up morph by casting ship attack skill.

§98.§0 Player can equip ship equipments in Morph GUI, equip slot is shared between all morph ship.

§99.§0 Press §cMorph Action§0 to toggle skill hotbar.

NOTE: Move speed will not apply to player (for now).
Player can §9Right Click§0 to use Repair Bucket, Combat Ration, Modernization Toolkit and Maintenance Personnel Training Book.

Please set "B:disable_health = true" for auto HP calculation or tweak ship HP in Metamorph config.
gui.shincolle.book.chap4.title: Ship List
gui.shincolle.book.chap4.text0d0:
The ship will be registered to list when the owner opens the ship inventory GUI.

§9Name:§0 Ship name.
§9Class:§0 Ship class, there are damage modifiers between ship classes.
§9Factory:§0 Construction location. Certain materials can increase the probs of construction.
gui.shincolle.book.chap4.text0d1:
The number represents the total amount of materials. §4EX: §dGrudge (4000):§0 The default highest probability is 4000 materials. If you set up 1000 Grudge, you just need 4000 - 1000 = 3000 materials to get the highest probability.
§9AuraEffect:§0
Special ability for married ships that owner can enable/disable in AI options.
§9OtherEffect:§0
Other abilities like critical passive ability.

gui.shincolle.book.chap5.text0d0:
Kanmusu is an aggressive evil ship, the biggest enemy of Shinkeiseikan.

If the owner stays in a water biome with a §dShinkeiseikan Wedding Ring§0 in their inventory, the fleet of Kanmusu may appear on the sea nearby.
gui.shincolle.book.chap5.text0d1: Defeating a fleet may reward the spawn egg of a Kanmusu. Register the Kanmusu by opening the ship inventory GUI.

§9AuraEffect:§0
+"Night Vision" to nearby ships
§9OtherEffect:§0
+"Blind" on attack
Enhanced melee to 150%% firepower

No problem cannot be solved (physically) with her brain.
gui.shincolle.book.chap6.title: Commands
gui.shincolle.book.chap6.text0d1:
§9/shipchangeowner§c
§dAuthority:§0 OP only
§dPurpose:§0 change ship's owner

OP, Ship and Player A must be online and in the same dimension (world).

The owner of the ship the OP's cursor is on will be changed to Player A.
gui.shincolle.book.chap6.text1d0:
§9/shipupdateowneruid§3 [Player Name]
§dAuthority:§0 All Player
§dPurpose:§0 update ship's owner UID

If the ship does not respond, try this command to fix the bug. OP can specify a player to update the UID.

This command only affects the ships in the loaded chunk and the target player must be online.
If the command does not work, try /shipchangeowner to change ship's owner 1 by 1.
gui.shincolle.book.chap6.text1d1:
§9/shipattrs [ ]
§dAuthority:§0 OP only
§dPurpose:§0 change ship attributes

Change the level and six main attributes of the ship which the cursor is on. Valid value: Ship LV = 1~150, Attrs LV = 0~100.
gui.shincolle.book.chap6.text2d0:
§9/shipcleardrop [range]
§dAuthority:§0 OP only
§dPurpose:§0 remove drop item (grudge entity)

Remove drop item entity within range, default range = 128 blocks.
gui.shincolle.book.chap6.text2d1:
§9/shipemotes [emo]
§dAuthority:§0 All Player
§dPurpose:§0 Show emotes
§dAlias:§9/em, /emo, /emote, /emotes§0

Use the "tab" key to show the emotes list when typing.
gui.shincolle.book.chap6.text3d0:
§9/shipstopai
§dAuthority:§0 OP only
§dPurpose:§0 stop ship AI

Stop all ship, hostile ship, ship mounts AI and update methods for emergencies like an entity dupe bug.
gui.shincolle.book.chap6.text3d1:
§9/shipkill [range]
§dAuthority:§0 OP only
§dPurpose:§0 remove a ship

Remove specific class ship within range (default range = 128 blocks) for emergency like an entity dupe bug.

The ship ID is same as the metavalue of ship spawn egg.
gui.shincolle.book.chap6.text4d0:
§9/ship | |
§dAuthority:§0 OP only: get, del
§dPurpose:§0 list or respawn ship

§9list:§0
list all ship cache data, D/E means Dead/Exist in the world.
§9get:§0
summon or respawn ship, the user must be within 64 blocks of the ship.
§9del:§0
delete the specific ship cache.

OP can use this command to summon/respawn missing ships. Non-OP users can search ship cache only.
gui.shincolle.crane.nowait1: Stop craning immediately if no item can load/unload
gui.shincolle.crane.excess1: LOADING: exceed the specified amount of stacks in the ship
gui.shincolle.crane.excess2: UNLOADING: exceed the specified amount of stacks in the chest
gui.shincolle.crane.remain1: LOADING: leave the specified amount of stacks in the chest
gui.shincolle.crane.remain2: UNLOADING: leave the specified amount of stacks in the ship
gui.shincolle.modernkit: Right click on seikan to increase a random attribute by 1.
gui.shincolle.wrench3: Sneak + Right Click: Pair crane and chest / Set Abyssal Waypoint
gui.shincolle.compass: Ship gets a ChunkLoader to work away from the owner
gui.shincolle.drum1: Ship can transport liquid to liquid container in the cabin.
gui.shincolle.drum2a: Ship can transport EU to EU storage in the cabin.
gui.shincolle.searchlight: Lights up if the ship is in the dark
gui.shincolle.combatration0:
Easy to carry, be careful
don't fall into the sea.
gui.shincolle.combatration1:
Grudge flavored rice balls, suitable for
Shinkeiseikan's heavy flavors.
gui.shincolle.combatration2:
Easy to carry, be careful the nearby aircraft carrier
when activated!
gui.shincolle.combatration3:
Grudge flavored rice ball, it looks red and shiny
and exudes a strange atmosphere.
gui.shincolle.combatration4:
It's mellow, dense, refreshing and smooth,
the best ice cream to beat the heat!
gui.shincolle.combatration5:
It's mellow, dense, refreshing and smooth,
don't afraid to get fat by having this
low-grudge ice cream!

gui.shincolle.equip.cluster: Releasing smaller bomb on the move.
